title: i got banned for saying kys
body:
our rumble top was afk for 20+ minutes and came back when we had already lost 
the some pixels in screen got me banned and rumble propably didnt get everything for faking 20+ minutes 
wp riot you banning sustem really sucks ass hope yoo fix this so if your afk 5 minutes ingame its a remake automatically 
its nonsense that someone can afk 20+ minutes in same game 
waste of time 
i like this game but this banning system is too fucked yp 
im very dissapointed :) 
unban my acc so i can play again 
ban me again and ill sell everyones acc passwords to internet

replies.body: Deserved ban.
agreed
isnt the real problem you telling someone to end their lifes over a game?
This ban was really undeserved, I see nothing wrong in calling out an afk troll, I don't know any online games that would ban you for something this ridiculous, only riot does that.
There's a difference between "calling out" and telling someone to kill themselves

I see nothing wrong in it, if a stranger told me to kill myself online I would just laugh it off, we got a choice whether we want to kill ourselves or not, it's not like it's gonna force us or anything, it's no different than the common insult to me.

Just because you are able to ignore it, it doesn't mean everyone else playing this game has that ability. Some people are either currently dealing with suicidal thoughts or have already lost friends and/or family to such an attempt. To them the phrase is in very poor and bad taste and if that means nothing to you then i feel sorry for you.
I feel nothing about it though, to me it's just the internet, no need to permaban people just for this very little.
RIOT and probably 99% of the playerbase disagree with you

Definitely not 99%, I know way too much people who hate this system, for all we know maybe the majority disagree with riot, but a small group of Riot fanboys is just what they can on this forum to shut down any dissident opinions, whoever speaks against this system is being shamed and downvoted. Happened to every threads that critisize this moderation system which is why I don't even dare make one of my own, I will be harassed and reported.

you realize that the majority of the things that the IFS flags as punishable are the same things that the majority would punish in the tribunal right?

you're essentailly getting a streamlined version of the majority opinion

and that opinion is that "KYS" is not welcome in any way, shape, or form.
I don't think most player agree the punishment is fair just for saying this lol.

yes they do, and it's not even close.

take a look at this thread for example: of the people who commented so far, 10 people think 'kys' should be punished, 1 didn't say either way and exactly 1 person (you) agrees with the OP

is it a legit sample size? no of course not. but if the majority thought like you do then why are you **LITERALLY THE ONLY ONE** speaking up for it? not to mention -26 is one of the larger neg posts i've seen on here

get over it man, it's a super shitty thing to say to another person no matter the situation or context. end of story.

and judging by your recent post history there is nothing to be gained by discussing things with you any further

deuces{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

Weird, Subdue and I have both made posts about the Zero Tolerance side of the system. Mainly that there is no chance of learning from a lesser offense after the 14 day ban. Neither of those posts, which are criticizing the system got more downvotes than upvotes. 

Why?
Because we gave constructive criticism and presented possible workable solutions.

> [{quoted}](name=Irelia Bronze5,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xEeFIstm,comment-id=000400010000,timestamp=2019-10-11T07:35:32.199+0000)
>
> I see nothing wrong in it, if a stranger told me to kill myself online I would just laugh it off, 

It's really not how an individual interprets a statement, but how it's interpreted by the greater community. Threats, hate speech, and self-harm references can be interpreted drastically and differently due to varying circumstances. While I'm grateful it doesn't affect you very much, that's not the same sentiment for other players who've actually dealt with or know others who have dealt with self-harm. Due to its severity, these topics are typically met with a 2-week suspension.

> [{quoted}](name=Periscope,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xEeFIstm,comment-id=0004000100000001,timestamp=2019-10-11T12:49:19.147+0000)
>
> It's really not how an individual interprets a statement, but how it's interpreted by the greater community. Threats, hate speech, and self-harm references can be interpreted drastically and differently due to varying circumstances. While I'm grateful it doesn't affect you very much, that's not the same sentiment for other players who've actually dealt with or know others who have dealt with self-harm. Due to its severity, these topics are typically met with a 2-week suspension.

Even further, it is how Riot sees it, that ultimately matters. They may take cues from the community on what to police and how, but they have no obligation to follow the community's ideals. It may not be wise to not take the community into account, but since it is Riot's property, they get to make the determination.

Note: I am not saying that they don't take the community into account (while some may disagree with that observation), I am just saying that we, the community, have no direct say in the rules.
